 PREV CLASS   NEXT CLASS FRAMES    NO FRAMES    
SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.versant.fund
Interface Session

All Superinterfaces:
ClassBuilder, SessionWithDatabase
public interface Session
extends SessionWithDatabase

A database session.

A database session interface that exposes methods that will be useful to a session at any tier in a multi-tiered database architecture. The FundSession class in this package implements the Session interface

See Also:
FundSession

Method Detail

emptyHandle

Handle emptyHandle()
Returns an empty handle referencing an empty database object.

The LOID of a null database object is (0.0.0). An empty handle is not a null Java reference.

See Also:
Handle.isEmpty()

newHandle

Handle newHandle(java.lang.String triple)
Returns a handle to an object.

This is a factory method that returns a Handle to a database object given its Logical Object Identifier (LOID) as a dotted decimal triple, e.g. "23.0.1066".

Parameters:
triple - A dotted decimal triple string representing a LOID

newHandle

Handle newHandle(byte[] loid)
Returns a handle to an object.

This factory method returns a Handle to a database object given its Logical Object Identifier (LOID) expressed as an array of eight bytes.

Parameters:
loid - A byte array representing a LOID

newHandle

Handle newHandle(long loid)
Returns a handle to an object.

This factory method returns a Handle to a database object given its Logical Object Identifier (LOID) expressed as a long integer.

Parameters:
loid - A byte array representing a LOID

newHandleVector

HandleVector newHandleVector()
Returns an empty HandleVector.

newHandleVector

HandleVector newHandleVector(Handle[] a)
Returns a HandleVector containing the same elements as the given array of Handles.

Parameters:
a - A Handle array from which to create a HandleVector

newHandleVector

HandleVector newHandleVector(HandleEnumeration e)
A factory method that makes an HandleVector, which contains Handles from the given HandleEnumeration.

Parameters:
e - An HandleEnumeration from which to create an HandleVector

newAttrBoolean

AttrBoolean newAttrBoolean(java.lang.String name)
Returns an instance of AttrBoolean whose name is the specified string.

This method creates a typed, named attribute object that can be used in the following ways:

  • Create a class.
  • Specify an attribute in newAttrBuilder().
  • Modify a class.
  • Specify an attribute in appendAttr(), dropAttr(), insertAttrsAt(), renameAttr().
  • Read an attribute.
  • Specify an attribute in get() on Handle.
  • Write an attribute.
  • Specify an attribute in put() on Handle.
  • Create a predicate for a query.
  • Specify an evaluation attribute when creating a predicate for select() or cursorSelect() on SelectBuilder.
An attribute object is initialized with the name of the attribute it references and the session in which it was created, but it does not contain information about a specific class or database. However, it does cache information about the most recent attribute referenced, so performance is better if each attribute object is used on instances of the same class.

An attribute object can be used only in the session in which it was created.

Parameters:
name - The new object name.
See Also:
SelectBuilder.select()

  • Specify an attribute in newAttrBuilder().
  • Modify a class.
  • Specify an attribute in appendAttr(), dropAttr(), insertAttrsAt(), renameAttr().
  • Read an attribute.
  • Specify an attribute in get() on Handle.
  • Write an attribute.
  • Specify an attribute in put() on Handle.
  • Create a predicate for a query.
  • Specify an evaluation attribute when creating a predicate for select() or cursorSelect() on SelectBuilder.

An attribute object is initialized with the name of the attribute it references and the session in which it was created, but it does not contain information about a specific class or database. However, it does cache information about the most recent attribute referenced, so performance is better if each attribute object is used on instances of the same class.

An attribute object can be used only in the session in which it was created.

Parameters:
name - The name of the new object.

newAttrShort

AttrShort newAttrShort(java.lang.String name)
Returns an instance of AttrShort whose name is the specified string.

This method creates a typed, named attribute object that can be used in the following ways:

  • Create a class.
  • Specify an attribute in newAttrBuilder().
  • Modify a class.
  • Specify an attribute in appendAttr(), dropAttr(), insertAttrsAt(), renameAttr().

newAttrBuilder

AttrBuilder newAttrBuilder(Attr a)
Returns an instance of AttrBuilder for the attribute specified as an instance of Attr.

This method is used by defineClass() to create a new database class and insertAttrsAt() to add new attributes.

Application should set the auxinfo(Type Descriptor) for the newly added attribute a. You can use setInfo() method of class Atrr to set this information.

If an evaluation attribute is a member of the class on which you are performing the query, you can use the following methods on Session to create the attribute parameter a:

newAttrBoolean()
newAttrBooleanArray()
newAttrByte()
newAttrByteArray()
newAttrDouble()
newAttrDoubleArray()
newAttrFloat()
newAttrFloatArray()
newAttrHandle()
newAttrHandleArray()
newAttrInt()
newAttrIntArray()
newAttrShort()
newAttrShortArray()
newAttrString()
newAttrString8Bit()

Parameters:
a - The new object name.
See Also:
ClassBuilder.defineClass(String), ClassHandle.insertAttrsAt(AttrBuilder[],int), ClassBuilder.withAttrBuilders(AttrBuilder[]), Attr.setInfo(String)

newSuperBuilder

SuperBuilder newSuperBuilder(java.lang.String superName)
A factory to make a SuperBuilder (used for defining classes).

Parameters:
superName - The name of the super class.

locateClass

ClassHandle locateClass(java.lang.String classname)
Returns a handle to the class named in classname.

The class object returned is locked with a read lock and pinned in memory.

By default, the class object is found in the session database. To locate a class in a non-session database, use withDatabase(), which is defined on both Session and ClassHandle.

Specified by:
locateClass in interface SessionWithDatabase
Parameters:
classname - The class name to locate.

defaultLockMode

int defaultLockMode()
Returns the current default lock mode.

defaultLockMode

void defaultLockMode(int lockmode)
Sets the default lock mode to the specified lock mode, lockmode.

Alternatives for lockmode are:

  • Constants.WLOCK: Write lock -- A write lock prevents others from reading or updating the locked object. If a write lock is placed on a class object, the effect is to write lock both the class and all of its instances.
  • Constants.RIWLOCK Read/Intention-Write lock -- A read/intention-write lock is only meaningful for a class object. It sets a read lock on instances of a class, and sets an intention write lock on the class object. This prevents others from updating locked instances or reading or updating the class object.
  • Constants.IWLOCK Intention-Write lock -- An intention-write lock is only meaningful for a class object. It prevents others from reading or updating a class object.
  • Constants.ULOCK Update lock -- An update lock prevents others from updating the locked object and guarantees that you are the next to get a write lock on the updated locked object.
  • Constants.RLOCK Read lock -- If on an instance, a read lock allows others to read the locked object but not update it. If on a class object, a read lock allows others to read instances and the class object but not update instances or the class object.
  • Constants.IRLOCK Intention-Read lock -- An intention-read lock is only meaningful for a class object. It allows others to read the class object but not update it.
  • Constants.NOLOCK No lock -- Also called a snapshot lock or a null lock. A no lock provides no concurrency guarantees. When used, a snapshot copy of the object is created regardless of other locks on the object. Updating a snapshot copy of an object creates a new object at the next commit.

The default, until reset, is a read lock, RLOCK. You can set read, write, update, or null lock modes as the default, but you cannot use intention lock modes as the default.

A default instance lock is translated to a default intention lock for the VERSANT database class object holding the schema definition of the instance. This means that a default read lock for an instance translates to a default intention read lock for a class object and a default write lock for an instance translates to a default intention write lock for a class object.

The defaultLockMode() method is useful when you want to access objects with a null lock after they have been returned by a query. When you perform a query, VERSANT places intention locks on the class objects for the objects returned but does not place a lock on the instances themselves. Later, when you try to access an instance by dereferencing it, VERSANT attempts to set the default lock. Since the default lock is a read lock, the function is blocked if the object already has a write lock. If all you need is a null lock, then use NOLOCK to reset the default lock to a snapshot lock and then retrieve the object.

Parameters:
lockmode - The lock mode to associate with this instance.

lockOfClassObject

int lockOfClassObject(int instanceLockmode)
Given the lock mode on an instance of a class, returns the recommended lock mode for the class object.

Alternatives for lock modes are:

  • Constants.WLOCK : Write lock
  • Constants.RIWLOCK : Read/intention-write lock
  • Constants.IWLOCK : Intention-write lock
  • Constants.ULOCK : Update lock
  • Constants.RLOCK : Read lock
  • Constants.IRLOCK : Intention-read lock
  • Constants.NOLOCK : No lock
See defaultLockMode() on Session for a list of lock modes.

Parameters:
instanceLockmode - The lock mode for this instance.

newSTHandle

Handle newSTHandle(int anInt)
Creates a handle to represent an integer value for Smalltalk defined schema.

The handle is stored in the database as a special case of o_stptr.

Parameters:
anInt - Integer value for new Handle.
